Account Executive (Majors to Enterprise)

Company Name DocuSign Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 71 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Account Executive - Majors to Enterprise


Thinking of a change? DocuSign is hiring! We were recently voted #22 on Glassdoor’s ‘Best Places to Work’ list, with our CEO being voted #3 top CEO to work for!



Benefits


  • A highly competetive salary package
  • Comprehensive medical cover
  • Paid volunteer time off
  • Excellent work/life balance
  • Fantastic parental leave policy

\xa0

\xa0


About DocuSign

\xa0

DocuSign\xae is changing how business gets done by empowering hundreds of thousands of customers and tens of millions of users in most countries around the world to sign, send and manage documents anytime, anywhere, on any device with confidence.


DocuSign replaces printing, faxing, scanning and overnighting documents with the easiest, fastest, most trusted way to make every approval and decision digital. Organizations of all sizes and industries are accelerating contracts, approvals and workflows with DocuSign's Digital Transaction Management (DTM) platform and eSignature solution.

\xa0

\xa0

\xa0

About The Position


The Account Executive is responsible for developing and closing new deals/opportunities within an assigned geographical territory. This Account Executive will acquire new customers as well as sell additional use cases, products and services into existing accounts.


Ultimately, the AE is accountable for exceeding monthly/quarterly quota, proactive deal management, forecast accuracy, and driving adoption/usage with customers and prospects in collaboration with internal teams and the broader DocuSign partners.


This position will report into the Regional Vice President of Commercial Sales.


\xa0


Responsibilities:


• Be a driving force in the success of the company’s goals and objectives through achieving individual sales quotas
• Develop and negotiate enterprise level proposals and contracts
• Accurately forecast sales activity and revenue achievement through proper use of sales tools
• Create and deliver customized sales presentations and high-impact demonstrations, by phone / web-demo
• Collaborate effectively and engage various pre/post sales resources including Sales Development Representatives, Market Development Representatives, Solutions Engineer, Account Managers, Partner Account Managers, as well as Legal, Security, Professional Services and Customer Support

\xa0

\xa0

\xa0

Required Experience


• BS/BA degree or equivalent in relevant sales experience
• 5-7 years of direct sales experience in a quota-carrying role

• 3+ years in SaaS sales preferred

\xa0

\xa0

\xa0

Preferred Experience


• Experience managing and closing complex sales-cycles
• Highly motivated self-starters; eager to learn, determined to adapt quickly, comfortable with some ambiguity.
• Track record of over-achieving quota (top 10-20% of company) in past positions
• Strong computer skills, including Salesforce, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel
• Willingness and ability to travel as necessary

\xa0

\xa0

Extra Information


What do Telstra, 7 out of the top 10 AU legal firms, PwC and Macquarie Bank know about DocuSign? Plenty!

\xa0
Our technology is transforming the way our customers live their lives and do business. Our Sales team is collaborating with customers across the globe to help them leverage our technology to change the way they do business. Our Business Development team is partnering with some of the largest most innovative companies in the world and in their industries to bring the power of DocuSign to more customers.

\xa0

Whether you are selling to an individual or a large enterprise, you will apply your extensive knowledge of our product and strategic partnerships to help our customers grow their top and bottom line.

\xa0

\xa0

\xa0

How To Apply

\xa0

To apply please send an updated copy of your resume to natalie.car@docusign.com or contact 02 9392 1986 for a confidential chat.

840217031:
[

Branch Manager - Mornington

Company Name Bank of Melbourne Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 23 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Bank Of Melbourne

Since Bank of Melbourne launched into the Victorian market in 2011 we have grown and invested in Victoria from 34 retail branches and 300 team members to 100+ branches and 1100 staff in the Bank of Melbourne team as well as our Melbourne made customer contact centre.

Bank of Melbourne is banking done differently. All you need to do is step into a Bank of Melbourne Branch and you know we are different, from our passionate and diverse team who put our customers at the centre of everything they do to our leading edge technology and digital capability.

Our Opportunity

Reporting to the Regional Executive, this is a fantastic opportunity to take the reigns of a key branch in our Bayside region at Mornington where you will lead, coach & motivate a small team of customer service & home finance sales professionals.

Our Branch Managers lead the way in shaping and growing 'their' business. While this role has a strong focus on financial accountability and operational and risk management of the branch, one of the most important aspects will be the leadership of the frontline banking team in delivering an exceptional customer experience that customers marvel at and tell their friends about.

What We Need From You
  • Significant retail banking experience is preferred, however, we will consider those applicants who do not possess this experience
  • Proven experience leading, coaching & motivating a team in sales & customer service
  • Knowledge of Banking products & services as well as tertiary qualifications will be well regarded
  • Experience developing, implementing & leading a local sales, business acquisition or marketing plan would be highly regarded
As mentioned above, whilst it would advantageous for candidates to possess a strong banking background & acumen, it is not a pre-requisite for the position. Equally important to our business is finding people with a passion for customer service & leaders who are enthusiastic about building & developing a successful team & branch.

You would describe yourself as someone who naturally enjoys helping people, you’ve built a successful career in customer-facing sales and service roles, you're known for building strong relationships with your customers & colleagues & this is all underpinned by your passion for delivering an exceptional customer experience at every opportunity.

Why this role is for you

You want different, not traditional. You love the challenge of a dynamic environment where you're setting a new benchmark in customer service. Leading multi-discipline teams doesn't faze you because that's where your experience lies.

You'll be accountable for your business as well as supported & empowered to make sound commercial decisions. You’ll get the opportunity to develop local sales strategies to enhance our footprint in your local neighbourhood.

Our commitment to you

Better banking can't be delivered without the right people. We understand that your satisfaction in what you do leads to our customers' satisfaction. We'll support and actively encourage your career development and growth, provide flexible work options and a host of some of the best financial & non-financial benefits out there.

Bank of Melbourne, as part of Westpac Group is an equal opportunity employer. As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility.

Where to from here?

If you would like to know more please contact Richard from the Bank of Melbourne recruitment team on Richard.maher@westpac.com.au

Job description

  • 52 Bed Psychiatric Hospital
  • Supportive team
  • Equivalent as recognised in Victoria or with AHPRA

Key Responsibilities
  • An exciting opportunity exists for suitably qualified person to work, as a group facilitator in The Geelong Clinic’s inpatient and day program services. The successful applicant/s will be required to work in a team approach, providing group therapy for patients who experience a range of psychiatric issues. The position also includes group work delivery, assessments, program recruitment and program administration.
  • Current vacancies focuses on the provision of high quality services to the inpatient program which provides services to patients experiencing a range of mental health conditions, including anxiety, depression, mood and personality disorders. Experience in Addiction, and Cognitive Behavioural Therapy, would be well regarded.
  • Support, professional development and supervision will be offered as part of the role.
The Geelong Clinic is a 52 bed Psychiatric Hospital that offers a range of inpatient, day programs and outreach services for individuals experiencing mental health problems. Located on the outskirts of Geelong within close proximity to spectacular coastal attractions, the clinic has a number of accredited Psychiatrists supported by a skilled multidisciplinary team of nursing, allied health, administration and domestic services staff.

Selection Criteria
  • Appropriate tertiary qualifications and registration in Psychology, Social Work, Occupational Therapy, Nutrition, Exercise Physiology or suitable
  • Equivalent as recognised in Victoria or with AHPRA
Applications close: Friday 14 September 2018

For further enquiries: Sue Murrant - Susan.Murrant@healthscope.com.au

CRM Strategy Manager

Company Name Sportsbet Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 64 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

You will lead our CRM Strategy and Insights team, focused on optimising the performance of our customer base. You’ll develop and manage customer segmentation and behavioural analysis to create new initiatives that increase our customer value. Your thinking and leadership will help us transition to a world of richer, more personalised experiences.

Company

Sportsbet is Australia’s leading online wagering company. We're part of a global company, a big player with a start-up soul. The pace of change is exhilarating, we’re constantly innovating to bring excitement to life for our customers and our people.

Perks
  • 5 weeks annual leave
  • Tailored career development programs, as well as a commitment to developing Thought Leader and Specialist Talent programs
  • Free brekky, discounted gym memberships, loads of event tickets
  • Best in class parental leave program with six months paid leave for primary carers


The Job

You’re passionate about customers and you’ll champion them at every stage of their journey. Working within the CRM team, you’ll provide strategic recommendations to build a scalable and engaging CRM program across the customer lifecycle and through tactical momentum opportunities.

Team

The objective of our CRM team is to encourage and increase loyalty and engagement across the customer base through personalised campaigns. You have the team and tools to execute on the innovative strategy driven by all teams at Sportsbet, putting the customer at the heart of every decision we make.

IS THIS ROLE FOR ME?
  • Advise on and design innovative, real-time contact strategies across a range of channels
  • Ensure that data is analysed into meaningful and actionable insights that will improve decision making and consequently drive business performance
  • Deliver complex analytical work in a simple and commercial manner to key stakeholders and the wider business
  • Develop customised data reports to inform strategic leadership decisions
  • Lead test and learn culture to increase effectiveness of communications.
  • Establish and develop strong relationships with Data Science, Analytics and other key stakeholders.
  • Strong Excel skills (minimum)
  • Strong SQL or equivalent (minimum)
  • Google Analytics experience preferred
  • Tableau preferred
  • Experience using and manipulating large datasets

You’re a mixture of the above, a true all-rounder! However, you will also have:
  • Big thinker that can attract, inspire and grow talent.
  • Ensure team development is nurtured and facilitate development opportunities as required.
  • Represent the CRM team in cross functional working groups, on specific projects and in project prioritisation
  • Genuine love for customers and finding more ways to meet their expressed and unexpressed needs
  • A curiosity to explore new ways of doing things by asking questions and tackling problems that create new opportunities

We encourage you to apply immediately as we will begin shortlisting within 1-2 weeks of advertising. Heads up - we use ability assessments, video assessments, interviews and a few toys in our Talent Assessment process!

At Sportsbet, we take Responsible Gambling very seriously. Check out the tools and information we provide our customers to help manage their gambling on our dedicated site at www.responsiblegambling.sportsbet.com.au

Logistics Operations Manager

Company Name Logical Executive Solutions Pty Ltd Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 194 views

Job description

  • Event Industry Local and International
  • Newly Created Position
  • Based in Ivanhoe


A leading Freight Forwarder in Australia’s exciting Events Industry is looking for an experienced Logistics Operations Manager. They service a wide range of events across the country including Exhibitions, Conferences and Outdoor Events.


This is an exciting time to join a young and growing organisation where the opportunity to grow with the business and share in its growth will be your reward.


This is a new position which will be responsible for:


  • Working with Account Managers and determining labour, equipment and other resources required to deliver projects;
  • Management and scheduling of supervisors, forklift drivers and labour;
  • Management and scheduling of equipment, forklifts, cranes;
  • Management of equipment and labour suppliers;
  • Working onsite at various events and venues throughout Australia, most events are in Melbourne, Sydney and Gold Coast/Brisbane;
  • Liaising with freight and transport co-ordinators assisting to ensure on-time delivery to and collection from events;
  • WHS/OHS Management;


Whilst experience in a similar role is essential, prior event industry experience is not mandatory. The necessary training and development will be provided to ensure your success.


The ideal candidate will be eager to learn, be a self-starter who is very well organised. A high attention to detail, excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the proven ability and willingness to get out and build relationships in the industry sector.


The company strictly adhere to WHS/OHS obligations as required by law and promote a fun, yet productive working environment.


If you require further information please contact Caroline Taylor at Logical Executive Solutions on (03) 8620 2807.\xa0

835934133:
[

Engineer Project Managers

Company Name Yarra Valley Water Company Location Mitcham, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 5 days ago Number of views 255 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Project manage the construction & delivery of new infrastructure assets
  • Full time permanent positions
  • Mitcham location with onsite parking


The Organisation
 Yarra Valley Water provides essential water supply and sanitation services to over 1.7 million people who live and work in the northern and eastern suburbs of Melbourne. As an industry leader involved in exciting and innovative service solutions, we are committed to delivering exemplary water and sanitation services that contribute to the health and well-being of current and future generations.

We're passionate about delivering extraordinary outcomes. Our award-winning culture fosters an inclusive, collaborative work environment and provides the development opportunities, flexibility and support that enable high levels of achievement and personal satisfaction. Our long term strategy includes a commitment to put customers at the centre of how we think, and what we do, and to adopt a restorative approach to looking after the environment. We're for thriving communities, and our work environment is a match for our strategic commitments.

The Role
 These roles are responsible for safely and efficiently delivering quality infrastructure assets in a way that ensures our customers receive the best value.

Key areas of responsibility include:

  • Proactively project managing the delivery of new assets from detailed design through to commission, in line with YVW's policies & procedures;
  • Liaise with stakeholders; including councils/contractors/internal Divisions and members of the public, on project related issues;
  • Contribute towards the development of project plans, particularly project audits and
  • Carry out all work in such a way as to protect your own health and safety and that of your fellow workers, contractors and public.


These roles will form part of the Growth Futures Division that is responsible for providing water and sewer services to new properties in a sustainable way, including planning and procuring new infrastructure and developing new and innovative sustainable servicing strategies to meet commercial and environmental objectives.

Skills and Experience
You will ideally be a Civil Engineer with at least 5 years experience and will utilise your skills and experience in a variety of water and/or sewer work including (but not limited to); planning, project management, construction management and treatment plants.

The successful candidates will be able to demonstrate the following;

  • A qualification in Engineering (preferably Civil) or a related discipline with eligibility for admission as a Member of the Institute of Engineers, Australia;
  • Demonstrated understanding of water supply systems;
  • Knowledge of and the ability to apply the principles of project management, contract management and tendering procedures;
  • Knowledge of and the ability to apply principles of the Occupational Health and Safety Act and the Environmental Protection Act and
  • Experience and demonstrated competency in working with and influencing key stakeholders.


If you meet the above criteria and are interested in pursuing a position in a dynamic environment, then we look forward to hearing from you. These roles are classified as an Engineer (an attractive salary range is available dependent on experience).

The Benefits

  • Flexible working arrangements considered
  • Generous personal leave entitlements
  • Training and development opportunities
  • Onsite parking, canteen and fitness group
  • Free flu vaccinations
  • Social events, skill-sharing and networking opportunities


How to apply
 Applications should be submitted through the 'Apply Now' button and include a supporting Cover Letter and Resume.

Closing date: Monday 24 September 2018

Yarra Valley Water is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, and strongly encourages applications from all types of people, from all walks of life. We believe diversity of thinking fosters innovation and delivers better outcomes for our customers, and we value a workforce that's a match for our diverse community.

This position is available for Yarra Valley Water employees and external applicants.
Successful applicants must be eligible to work in Australia and agree to provide information for pre-employment checks, if required for the position (which may include police records checks).

Seniority Level

Associate

Industry

  • Civil Engineering
  • Utilities

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Engineering
